extendedIngredients.name: apple
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 thin slices of your favorite apple (I used Honeycrisp)

recipes.title: Smoked Gouda, Apple and Bacon Quesadillas

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are my top picks for Fingerfood. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. You could try Bellissima Sparkling rosé. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Heat a large skillet over med-high heat.  Spray with cooking spray and place one tortilla on the skillet.  Sprinkle the tortilla with half the cheese to about 1/4" from the edges.  Arrange the apple slices and the bacon evenly over the cheese.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese and top with second tortilla.  Press down.  When the bottom tortilla is browned and the cheese begins to melt, carefully flip the quesadilla over to brown the second side and completely melt the cheese.  (about 1 - 2 minutes) Remove quesadilla to cutting board and let rest for 2 - 3 minutes.  Cut into 4 triangles.  Serving size is 2 triangles. Serve with honey mustard, if desired.

steps.step: Heat a large skillet over med-high heat.  Spray with cooking spray and place one tortilla on the skillet.  Sprinkle the tortilla with half the cheese to about 1/4" from the edges.  Arrange the apple slices and the bacon evenly over the cheese.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese and top with second tortilla.  Press down.  When the bottom tortilla is browned and the cheese begins to melt, carefully flip the quesadilla over to brown the second side and completely melt the cheese.  (about 1 - 2 minutes)
Remove quesadilla to cutting board and let rest for 2 - 3 minutes.
Cut into 4 triangles.  Serving size is 2 triangles.
Serve with honey mustard, if desired.
